Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2008 04:45PM Chris526 wrote: So glad that Xeloda is working for you.  I got the results of my latest scan and it showed progression. I have lesions in my liver, lungs, spine and bone - they were there before I started on Xeloda.  New lesions in my liver and lungs - probably other places but it is hard to write it down when you are getting the info on the phone.  My onc said they are all very small but still there.  Now I have to decide on treatment.  Do I stay on Xeloda?  It is hard to say that it is working for me.  I feel like a mess.  Maybe an increase in the Xeloda would do it...I am taking 3600 /day now. I just wish there was a book we could go to and it would tell us what to do next.
Posts.Title: Xeloda still working!!!!!! waterlily JoyRebecca

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 08:46AM Chris526 wrote: You will be in my thoughts and prayers
Posts.Title: requesting your prayers and insight KiminJax TripleNeg

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2008 06:11PM Chris526 wrote: I have learned a lot from this post.  I have liver, lung, bone mets but I am encouraged with the above posts.  I especially appreciate the info regarding the RFA.  The more knowledge you have going into your doctor appts the better you are...I learned that the hard way.  My rad. wanted me to have MRI for possible brain mets. But it scared me just to think of the possbility.  But after reading the above, I know I should have the MRI.  I was diagnosed in 2007 had chemo then lump then after PET/CT scan, found more diease in the breast then I had mast.  All was clear until the last PET/CT scan and as they put it "widespread involvement" so scary to come from all good to all bad.
Posts.Title: Some help and advice w/met to liver controlmydestiny controlmydestiny

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 04:49AM Chris526 wrote: I am so glad to see this thread.  I went Thurs. for my Zometa (sp) and my wc was 0.8; last time blood was drawn it was 4.6.  The nurse also told me that they watch NEUT ABSOL (?) which was 0.0.  They drew blood to do a culture and make sure I didn't have an infection but I haven't heard from them.  I know it takes a culture a day or two but....    So I am home not knowing what to do next, except I have to call them.  Why can't they for once close the loop.  I left hanging not knowing how long I have to avoid crowds or not see my granddaughter.

Posts.Content: May 8, 2008 06:19PM Chris526 wrote: Thanks so much for all your comments.  I have thought long and hard and will get 2nd/3rd opinion.  I told my  family and they were so happy.  I need to make sure they understand that I am doing everthing I can. Now, how does one go about getting a 2nd opinion?  My onc said she is not the type of doctor that would mind.  I have two facilities that I know I can get 2nd opinion.  I have already contacted one and they want me to send my records for review.  I guess I will call my onc's nurse and start with her.  I get so tired of thinking and doing. Thank you for all your support.  I started my Xeloda on Tues. and Wed. I had my first Zometa (?) infusion.  I was a little depressed going back to the chemo chairs...I really thought I was ok. Thanks

I am also triple negative - today is my first day on Xeloda
Posts.Title: Yup, It's lung mets and I'm triple neg sofeemay LuAnnH

Posts.Content: May 6, 2008 09:57PM Chris526 wrote: CalGal, Yes...I learned about the mets all in one call. I had a lump in Oct. '07 then a mast in Nov., (followed by rads), after a PET/CT scan showed additional tumors in the breast but all else was clean.   The PET/CT I had in May showed the mets.     My onc did base the dx on the PET/CT scan.  What would be the purpose of a liver or lung biopsy?    I am trying to learn but it is so much.  Every new step requires learning new terminology, new tests and results and then the most important part..knowing what questions to ask!!! My onc is starting me on Xeloda alone.  She would rather try one drug at a time - she feels there are more options.  If she gives me two drugs together and they didn't work...she wouldn't know which one didn't work which lessen my choices. Is Xeloda hard to tollerate?  I will also have an infusion once a month for the bone cancer. This is certainly an ongoing process

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 09:54AM Chris526 wrote: I was going to post my latest issue but deb711 already said it.  I am currently in the hospital (4 days and counting) because of a cough and very hard time breathing.  After many tests, they found fluid outside of my lung which prevented my lungs from expanding.  I don't think it had to do with a specific chemo, tho they were thinking it could be a allergic reaction to Navelbine (sp) a tube is inserted in the chest for about 24 hours then they will put either talc or whatever through the tube to try to get the edge of the lung to stick to the chest wall to decrease the chance of the fluid returning. I am not looking forward to that at all....but what can you do.  I am just grateful that I can breath again.  I will let you know who it goes.

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2008 01:20PM Chris526 wrote: Deb, I am not sure if this will work but yesterday I was at the eye doctor and I was having trouble seeing out of my left eye.  The baby doctor (they are all so young) put a plastic form in front of my left eye which contained little holes ---- I could see.  He said that way back when, if you were having trouble seeing they would prick tiny holes in a piece of paper and put it to you eye and you could see.  It is worth a try.  I hope it works.
